Introduction

All, companies big and small, need systems for gathering and organizing financial information.

Just as FedEx must monitor and evaliate its use of $12.6 billion in delivery equipment, smaller companies must track the financial results of their activities. Accounting ststems provide the financial information companies need to manage their businesses and report their results to others interested in the business.

Fron the moment a company is organized it engages in financing and investing activities that need to be accounted for. In this chapter, you'll learn how these activities are captured in an accounting system, leading to the assets, liabilities and stockholders equity that are reported on the balance sheet.
